description.narrative: Cennergi (Pty) Ltd (the Company), a 50:50 JV Company between Exxaro Resources Ltd (Exxaro) and The Tata Power Company (Tata Power), wants to develop, build, own and operate the Amakhala Wind Farm Project (Amakhala, the Project). Amakhala is a 138.6 MW greenfield project between the towns of Bedford and Cookhouse in the Eastern Cape province of South Africa that achieved preferred bidder status in Round 2 of South Africas Renewable Energy IPP procurement program. The Project will be undertaken through a special purpose vehicle (SPV) named Amakhala Emoyeni RE Project 1 (Pty) Ltd. The Project output will be sold to Eskom SOC Limited, the integrated power utility in South Africa, under a 20 year Power Purchase Agreement (PPA).

The project will: (i) promote additional employment and skills development during construction and operation; (ii) diversify South Africa''s energy mix; (iii) reduce carbon emissions by producing green, emission-free electricity; (iv) contribute to increased generation capacity in South Africa (as part of the planned system expansion); (v) contribute to the upliftment of local communities, through financial benefits flowing from a 5% carried shareholding to be held via two local community trusts; and (vi)provide positive demonstration effects in South Africa and the neighboring countries, as one of the initial large wind projects in the region.

name.narrative: The Project is located between the towns of Bedford and Cookhouse in the Eastern Cape province of South Africa. The Project area covers 13,000 ha of grazing land, incorporating portions of 5 different commercial agricultural farms, which have been leased. The Project foot print is estimated at not more than 75 ha (based on permanent alteration and construction plans). The site is accessible through national roads (N1 and N10) from Port Elizabeth harbor, and eventually through a regional road - R350.
